answers.answer: Hi,How are you? The eGFR test is used to screen and detect early kidney damage and to monitor kidney status. It is performed by ordering a creatinine test and calculating the eGFR.. A GFR of ninety or more is a sign of normalcy and a  eGFR below 60 ml/min suggests that some kidney damage has occurred. he test results from an eGFR test can be a bit complicated to understand and warrants evaluation by your attending physician. Factors such as symptoms, medical history ( presence of diabetes, hypertension, etc) and results of other diagnostic tests are important considerations. Hope this helps, Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I had a chemistry test and everything seen to be with in the normal range , but the only thing that got me concern is this test call eGFRin my test results it says the following:NON- AFRICAN AMERICAN eGFR  108             mL/min/1.73m2(> OR = 60)AFRICAN AMERICAN    eGFR         125             mL/min/1.73m2(> OR = 60)please help I dont understand !~
title: Help understanding lab results
